Base: A Bounty Hunter's signature ability is that they always manage to find their target - no matter how well they hide.

Spies know foiling the plots of enemy agents is always paramount, and devote much preparation to thwarting these schemes. This might be done via hiding weapons in a meeting place, ensuring "innocent bystanders" are in fact armed backup, or other cunning and clever ploys. The more agents are aware of their opposite numbers and enemy tactics, the better they can achieve their goals. Counterespionage ideally leads to the grand prize: turning an enemy into a valuable double agent.
This ability allows a Warrior to lean into their savage reputation to intimidate an opponent and reduce their ability to do anything.
The epitome of a diplomat's career, the Diplomatic Solution ability can lead what may have been a firefight into a calm social interaction.
This signature ability allows one to challenge an opponent to a duel, in which they may only make attacks against each-other.
The Colonist benefits from tremendous insight, capable of ascertaining details of their situation that may have previously eluded them and others.
A skilled technician's signature ability allows them to take what they have and construct a piece of equipment that functions exactly as a product already on the market for as long as it is needed.
The Hired Gun may very well be the last one standing when things go south, this signature ability allowing them to completely obliterate all living things they can see.
This signature ability allows a character to bestow a talent that they possess onto an ally (at the same rank).
This ability of the Sentinel allows the character to make a knowledge check in an urban setting to learn or recall the location of anything or anyone in the city.
This signature ability exemplifies the Smuggler's slippery state of being, often capable of making a getaway where many would have fallen into the hands of the law or a trap.
This signature ability is the pinnacle ability of the Jedi to defend themselves, allowing them to parry and reflect so much more.
This signature ability for Mystics allows them to have a vision of the future which may work to their advantage - even form the future.
This signature ability available to a Commander has the power to convince and inspire a group of people to fight, despite original hesitation. They may even cause a turning point in a mass battle.

An explorer, with all their experience in the fringe, has an unnatural ability to keep their bearings - no matter how lost they may seem... even potentially discover the location of a hidden structure.
The heavy-based Soldier's signature ability is all about destroying large vehicles without large weapons.
The Engineer is an expert at building constructs (vehicles, buildings and droids)... and this signature ability uses that expertise for demolishing them in the most efficient way possible.
The Ace is able to challenge another vessel to a duel, evading the chaos of the battlefield in an effort to take down this other vessel.
This specialisation for the Seeker career allows the individual to instantly incapacitate a target in combat.
A true commander will use this signature ability in order to take full command of their troops and manage them perfectly through battle, without having their authority questioned.
A technician may benefit from Unmatched Calibration, allowing them to perhaps realise something critical in the process of their work at the right time to achieve success or avoid catastrophe.

Once per game session, as an out of turn incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to ignore the effects of all Critical Injuries for 2 rounds. When this effect ends, he suffers the effects of these Critical Injuries as normal.
top1_desc: While Unmatched Courage is active, whenever the character would suffer strain, he may suffer that many wounds instead.
top2_desc: Unmatched Courage lasts for 2 additional rounds
top3_desc: While Unmatched Courage is active, add 1 boost die to checks to remove Critical Injuries.
top4_desc: Unmatched Courage lasts for 2 additional rounds
bot1_desc: While Unmatched Courage is active, the character does not become incapacitated when his wounds exceed his wound threshold.
bot2_desc: While Unmatched Courage is active, the character adds +2 damage for each Critical Injury he is suffering to the first hit of each successful combat check he makes.
bot3_desc: While Unmatched Courage is active, add 1 boost die to checks to remove Critical Injuries.
bot4_desc: When Unmatched Courage ends, make a Hard Resilience check to remove one Critical Injury

Base: This signature ability allows a Mystic to improve their force power checks significantly.

Once per game session as an incidental, after performing a combat check, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to perform an additional combat check against the same target with the difficulty increased by 1 for each successful combat check the character has performed this turn. This combat check must be made using a non-starship/vehicle weapon that the character has not already used this turn.
top1_desc: Perform additional combat checks equal to ranks in Increase Number upgrade.
top2_desc: Before performing each combat check with Unmatched Devastation, the character may holster and draw a weapon.
top3_desc: The character may choose a new legal target for each combat check made as part of Unmatch Devastation.
top4_desc: When making a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, remove one setback die equal to ranks in Remove Setback upgrade.
bot1_desc: Perform additional combat checks equal to ranks in Increase Number upgrade.
bot2_desc: When making a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, remove one setback die equal to ranks in Remove Setback upgrade.
bot3_desc: Before performing a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, suffer 2 strain to perform the Move maneuver as an incidental
bot4_desc: Perform additional combat checks equal to ranks in Increase Number upgrade.

Base: A colonist is often an educated individual, much more capable than they appear and sometimes completes tasks much more easily than others.
Unmatched Ferocity allows the Warrior to launch a repeated set of attacks against a single target to absolutely destroy them.
It often appears that those taking the most risks are often the most lucky, and this signature ability for the smuggler follows in that vein, allowing one to make sure their luck strikes true.
This signature ability is the very representation of the Guardian's purpose. Putting others' safety before his own.
The best engineers can use this signature ability to make small modifications and jury-rig their equipment on the fly for what they need it to do.
Due to a diplomat's frequent interactions with an array of people and cultures allows for an unmatched insight which will prove useful in any social encounter.

An explorer survives in the wild due to their ability to keep out of harms way and speed. This signature ability exemplifies this, allowing an explorer to suddenly move about and do a lot more in a short period of time.
This signature ability significantly improves the likelihood of success of any form of negotiation checks for a limited time.
Experiencing constant fighting, the Hired Gun has no rival in the amount of punishment they can take - even appearing invincible to many foes thanks to this signature ability.
This specialisation allows an individual to keep on track of an otherwise elusive opponent.
The Ace is able to hold their ship together despite crippling damage and continue fighting or escape.
This signature ability allows a clone soldier to provide assistance to their fellow team members in a way like no other. It represents the great bonds between clone troopers.
Experts at deception, this Spy signature ability allows them to deceive the least gullible of people with relative ease.
This allows a Sentinel to be prepared for anything at any time, making their response to unexpected and expected situations alike rather swift.
